qas.question: What is the meaning of Thorn Ey?
When was a church first founded at the site?
When was construction of the present church started?
Who ordered the construction of the church?
What year did the destruction of the church begin?
Who commissioned the Abbey to be destroyed?
What was the area never named?
In what century wasn't the church established at the location?
Who wasn't the Bishop in this time frame?

context: According to a tradition first reported by Sulcard in about 1080, a church was founded at the site (then known as <b7_0>Thorn Ey (<a0_0>Thorn Island<a0_0/>)<b7_0/>) in the <a1_0><b8_0>7th century<b8_0/><a1_0/>, at the time of <b9_0>Mellitus, <a2_0>a Bishop of London<b9_0/><a2_0/>. Construction of the present church began in <a3_0><b5_0>1245<b5_0/><a3_0/>, on the orders of <a4_0><b6_0>King Henry III<b6_0/><a4_0/>.
